me.tatarka.ipromise

Class Promise<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.tatarka.ipromise.Promise<T>

  • public class Promise<T>
extends java.lang.Object

    A promise is a way to return a result the will be fulfilled sometime in the future. This fixes the inversion of control that callback-style functions creates and restores the composeability of return values.

    In addition to creating a standard interface for all asynchronous functions, Promises can also more-robustly handle error and cancellation situations.

    You cannot construct a Promise directly, instead you must get one from a Deferred. That is, unless the result is already available.

    See Also:
    Deferred

      The Exception thrown if a result has already been delivered and a second result is attempted to be delivered.

      • listen

        public Promise<T> listen(Listener<T> listener)
        Listens to a Promise, getting a result whenever a message is sent. If and how many previous results are returned depends on the PromiseBuffer.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to call when the promise receives a message
        Returns:
        the Promise for chaining

      • onListen

        protected void onListen(Listener<T> listener)

      • onClose

        public Promise<T> onClose(CloseListener listener)
        Listens to a Promise, receiving a callback when it is closed, i.e. it wont receive any more messages. If the Promise is already closed, the callback will be called immediately.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener
        Returns:
        the Promise for chaining

      • then

        public <T2> Promise<T2> then(Map<T,T2> map)
        Constructs a new Promise that returns when the original promise returns but passes the result through the given Map function.
        Type Parameters:
        T2 - the result type of the new Promise
        Parameters:
        map - the function to chain the result of the original Promise to the new promise
        Returns:
        the new Promise

      • then

        public <T2> Promise<T2> then(Chain<T,Promise<T2>> chain)
        Constructs a new Promise that chains two promises in succession.
        Type Parameters:
        T2 - the type of the second Promise result
        Parameters:
        chain - the Chain that constructs the second Promise
        Returns:
        the new Promise

      • then

        public Promise<T> then(Filter<T> filter)
        Constructs a new Promise that filters this Promise. i.e. the new Promise will not receive any messages when Filter.filter(Object) returns false.
        Parameters:
        filter - the filter
        Returns:
        the new Progress

      • batch

        public Promise<java.util.List<T>> batch(int size)
        Constructs a new Promise that batches the messages of this Promise.
        Parameters:
        size - the batch's size. The new Promise will be called every time this many messages are sent, and again with the remaining messages when the Promise is closed.
        Returns:
        the new Promise

      • and

        public <T2> Promise<Pair<T,T2>> and(Promise<T2> promise)
        Constructs a new Promise that receives a message after both of the given promises receive a message. This is a type-safe version of and(Promise[]) for two promises.
        Type Parameters:
        T2 - the type of the other Promise
        Parameters:
        promise - the other Promise
        Returns:
        the new Promise
        See Also:
        and(Promise[])

      • and

        public static Promise<java.lang.Object[]> and(Promise... promises)
        Constructs a new Promise that waits before all given promises receive a message before sending them to the new Promise, minus any promises that have already been closed. The resulting array will contain the messages at the same indices as the corresponding promises. If the promise has been closed, the corresponding message will be null. The new Promise is closed, when all of the given promises are closed.
        Parameters:
        promises - the promises
        Returns:
        the new Promise

      • merge

        public Promise<T> merge(Promise<? extends T> promise)
        Constructs a new Promise that receives a message when either of the given promises receive a message. This is a type-safe version of merge(Promise[]) for two promises.
        Parameters:
        promise - the other Promise.
        Returns:
        the new Promise
        See Also:
        merge(Promise[])

      • merge

        public static Promise<java.lang.Object> merge(Promise... promises)
        Constructs a new Promise that receives a message when any of the given promises receive a message.
        Parameters:
        promises - the promises
        Returns:
        the new Promise

      • cast

        public <T2> Promise<T2> cast()
        Forces a cast of a promise to a super-type to get around covariance restrictions. T2 must be a superclass of T. This is safe because you can't directly deliver results to the cast promise.
        Type Parameters:
        T2 - the type of the result to cast to
        Returns:
        a cast of the promise
